form.name: form1

span.p: As of April 20th, 2020 the closure has been extended for the REMAINDER of the school year.

img.alt: Laws of Life Essay Contest Winners

span.div: The Coshocton City Schools Board of Education issued a Teacher and Staff Appreciation Proclamation at the March 16, 2020 Board of Education Meeting. The week of May 4-8 has been proclaimed as Teacher and Staff Appreciation Week, a time to recognize the efforts of educators in our district and thank the many teachers and staff who work with our children in the Coshocton City Schools.

div.a: Board of Education Issues Commendations to Employees and Students and Families

span.div: The Coshocton City Schools Board of Education awarded two commendations at their March 16, 2019 Board of Education Meeting.

The first commendation was for Coshocton City Schools Employees for supporting our students, families and each other while remaining flexible, demonstrating perseverance, and remaining positive during the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020.

The second commendation was for Coshocton City Schools Students and Families for continuing to complete schoolwork, learning and engaging in new ways, supporting our teachers and staff, and supporting our community while remaining flexible, demonstrating perseverance and remaining positive during the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020.
The commendations may be viewed at:

div.a: All Call Message from the Superintendent - April 20, 2020

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.div: "Good evening. This is Dave Hire, Superintendent of the Coshocton City Schools, and today is Monday, April 20th and this message is for all students and parents. This afternoon, Governor DeWine announced that all school buildings will remain closed for the remainder of this school year. There will be implications for many of our year-end events and activities, and we will communicate decisions just as soon as possible. I know this is very disappointingnews for our students and families, and especially our seniors, and we will work together to be innovative and creative to honor our students as we conclude this school year. We will continue to follow the "Stay at Home" order and guidelines related to mass gathering limitations. These orders will certainly impact our ability to consider options for events at the end of this school year. Understand that this will be a work in progress as we move forward.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.div: I know that this is a difficult time for our families and students, and we know life can be stressful when you are cooped up inside each day without seeing friends and extended family. We ask that you continue to encourage your children to do their work each day, if able. It can be very helpful to keep children in a dailyroutine, and it can help to keep children engaged in something meaningful.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.div: On another note, we continue to provide meals on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Please see our school website for remote locations and times. We offer curbside service at our elementary school from 10:30am to 12:30pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.div: There has been no decision regarding the status of returning to school in the fall. We will continue to keep you informed as we gain guidance from the state and the Ohio Department ofEducation. At this time, please help us to continue our current process of providing instruction remotely. Contact your teachers or building principals if you need assistance with any assignments or expectations. Our goal is to keep students engaged in the learning process during this time, and we expect students to continue to learn. Again, we appreciate your help at home. We miss our students and I hope that all of you and your loved ones remain safe and well."

div.a: Ohio Department of Education Releases Parents and Caregiver Resources

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Click the link below to view the Parent and Caregiver Resources that have been released by the Ohio Department of Education. These resources

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: are available to support engaging students in learning during the school-building closure period.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
span.a: CLICK HERE TO VIEW PARENT/CAREGIVER RESOURCES

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Coshocton Elementary School

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Academic Expectations Per Week

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To: All CES Parents:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: From: Dave Skelton, Principal

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Date: April 6, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This is our fourth week without students. We receive new information every day and it is sometimes overwhelming. I am certain you have had this feeling many times. We want to help by providing a structure of what is expected, how much is expected, and how often it is expected.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: 4 days a week, your student in grades K-2 should be getting:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of ELA instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Math instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Science or Social Studies instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Related Arts instruction and activities

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: 4 days a week, your student in grades 3-6 should be getting:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of ELA instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Math instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Science instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Social Studies instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Related Arts instruction and activities

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: One day a week, students will

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: not be given any new assignments

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: , but instead will be provided potential extension activities or extra support time to catch up on their work. Our teachers will still be available to help students from 9:00-2:00PM. All of our teachers can be contacted by email and they will respond asap. You should have their email address. If not, please call our school office at 622-5514 between the hours of 9:00-2:00PM. Again, teachers are available Monday-Friday from 9-2 for any questions or concerns. If you need help outside of that time, please email, and they will respond as soon as possible. We are here to help our students, so do not hesitate to contact the teacher by email.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please keep in mind that we want to be supportive of your childs learning and want to make sure we are attentive to their emotional health during this time. Let us know if you are struggling and we can help support you during this unexpected closure. As you know, parents need to help to their children during this time. Please use your judgement to guide your children as they work so they do not become anxious or overwhelmed. It is alright for children to need a break while working on an assignment.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please know that you are in my thoughts and trust that we will be here to help you and your children.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dave Skelton

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Principal

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.a: CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE CES STUDENT ACADEMIC EXPECTATIONS

br.span: Kindergarten registration has been postponed until further notice. Please continue to watch our website and social media sites for further information.

div.a: All Call Message from the Superintendent - April 3, 2020

span.style: color: #666666; font-family: Arial, sans-serif

span.span: The Governor has extended the Stay at Home order through May 1st, so we will continue with our current process through this month of April. I know this is a tough situation for everyone involved, and I want to say THANK YOU to all of our students and parents. You are to be commended for your hard work over the past few weeks. You are doing a great job and we will continue to make adjustments to student assignments to keep this new method of learning from becoming overwhelming and stressful. Students and parents can continue to receive assignments through teacher communications and through postings on our website. Please let your teachers or building administrators know if you are having any issues. We will work to resolve these as soon as possible. Thank you for helping with these assignments as we work to continue the learning process. We know these can be very stressful times and we appreciate your patience and understanding. Stay safe. We will get through this because we are Coshocton Strong!

p.span: On a different note, next weekend is Easter, and next Friday, April 10th is a holiday so there is no school for students or staff on Good Friday. There will be no assignments on Friday, April 10th. Please enjoy the day with your family. Thanks for listening and have a great evening!

div.a: Student Meal Service Schedule Change and Location Change Effective Tuesday, March 24, 2020

span.style: font-size: 16pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Coshocton City Schools Student Meal Service Schedule: Tuesday's andThursday's (March 23, 2020- April 3, 2020.Click the link above to view the entire article that includes locations/times for dropoff and pickup.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial

span.span: Due to the current pandemic, Coshocton 8th Graders will not be traveling to Washington, DC in May. This is a wonderful opportunity for our students, so CHS has rescheduled the trip for this fall. The Students will now be traveling October 26-28, 2020. All payments will be transferred to this new trip. Due to the Stay-at-Home order from the Governor, the CHS office will be closed starting tomorrow. If you still owe money towards your childs trip, please hold onto your payment until we return to school or the office reopens. If you decide that your child will not be going on the trip next fall, please email the CHS Trip Coordinator, Christi Fauver, at[emailprotected]or message her on Remind

span.style: font-size: small; color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: Good afternoon, this is Dave Hire, Superintendent of the Coshocton City Schools. Today is Wednesday, March 18th and I have a few updates.

p.span: Monday thru Friday -March 23, 2020 to April 3, 2020

span.span: Student meals can be picked up
. Please pull to the lower level entrance by the gym doors. This is the entrance where students are dropped for school each morning. Staff will be there to assist in picking up the meals.

span.strong: Student meals can also be picked upatthe following locations 10:30-11:00 a.m.each day:

p.span: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

span.b: First Baptist Church on Chestnut St (across from the Pit Stop)

div.span: Students will receive a breakfast and lunch each day. Any child 18 or under is welcome. The student or child will need to be present to receive meals.
We are asking that you stay in your vehicle if you drive to pick up meals. Please remind your children to practice social distancing when receiving their meals.
Any questions or concerns about meal service? Feel free to email Jennifer Andrews, or contact the Elementary or HS office between 9 a.m. and 2 p.m.
